snippet: In the first major break in the hunt for the Boston Marathon bomber, F.B.I. personnel found security video showing a man they believe may have played a role in planting explosives.
abstract: Federal Bureau of Investigation personnel find security video clips showing man they believe to have played role in planting explosives in Boston Marathon bombing; videos show handful of others whom authorities want to question, either because of what they appear to be doing or their proximity to blasts; it is first major break in case.

byline.original: By KATHARINE Q. SEELYE, SCOTT SHANE and MICHAEL S. SCHMIDT
byline.contributor: Katharine Q. Seelye reported from Boston, and Scott Shane and Michael S. Schmidt from Washington. Reporting was contributed by John Eligon, Richard A. Oppel Jr. and Jess Bidgood from Boston; Michael Cooper, William K. Rashbaum and Brian Stelter from New York; and Eric Schmitt from Washington.

lead_paragraph: In the first major break in the hunt for the Boston Marathon bomber, F.B.I. personnel found security video showing a man they believe may have played a role in planting explosives.

headline.main: Suspicions in Boston Attack Turn to Man Seen in Videos
headline.print_headline: Suspicions in Boston Attack Turn to Man Seen in Videos
